supportDesc.foliation: Marked in pencil on top. Folio 95 marked twice. 95bis being in this record. Two paper endleaves at the front and two paper endleaves at the back without any foliation.

item.desc: Unidentified text about Mary and Jesus. The beginning is missing.
Fragments of with musical notations. With rubrications on , but gaps left blank for rubrications on .

Collection of seven qǝne-poems by a later and hasty hand, each poem bearing an indication of type for each poem, but with no indication of the author or collector: on fol. 5vb, on the bottom margin of fol. 5v, on fol. 7ra, on fol. 7ra, on fol. 7ra-b, on fol. 7rb and on fol. 7rb.
Unidentified text, possibly a fragment of an elegy. The beginning and the end are missing.
item.q: ሀቦሙ፡ ሰማይ፡ ወህብስተ፡ ህብስተ፡ መላእክቲሃበልኢሕእጓለእመህያው። ግእዝ፡ መንፈሰከ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ፈኑ፡ በነ፡ መንፈስ፡ ጽድቅ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ገ፡ ይማኖት።

item.desc: Unidentified text, possibly a fragment of an elegy. The beginning and the end are missing.
item.q: ሶበ፡ ተመጠውከ፡ ነቀአ፡ ርባነ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ አፉከ፡ ዘንተ፡ ባል፡ በለሐስስ። መንበረ፡ አመ፡ ይወ፡ ኣዳ። አ በትረ። መአዛ፧ ይሁቡ፡ ሶበ፡ ይጓ፡ ሐሊ። ለሰር። ለለእ። ማግ፡

origin.origDate: The manuscript is a palimpsest and the overtext of the late 17th or 18th century was written on an earlier layer of writing containing fragments of diverse texts from differents codices from the 13th to 16th century, each of which are recorded here as textual units. The presence of undertexts of at least 10 distinct codices antiquiores point to a dismembering and palimpsesting in the Ethiopian community in Jerusalem.

history.provenance: According to ii , the manuscript was acquired by at some time during his travels in the Levant and Egypt, possibly during his stay as vice consul in Jerusalem in 1868.
history.acquisition: The manuscript was bought by the then Königliche Bibliothek zu Berlin in 1873.

msItem.note: The excerpt was used in , where it was given siglum D.
According to 410, note 63 , it is one out of two identified witnesses of the 'Abridged Version of the β-recension of the Tārika Walda ʾAmid', alongside .

msItem.incipit: በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መስተ፡ ሣህል፡ ንጽሕፍ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ታሪክ፡ ዘአስተጋብአ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወልደ፡ አሚድ፡
ይቤ፡ ከመ፡ ቃለ፡ ኦሪት፡ በዕለተ፡ እኁድ፡ ፈጠረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ፰ ስርተ፡ ፬ ጠቢብ፡ ወ፯ በአርምሞ።
msItem.explicit: ወበዕለተ፡ ሳብዕት፡ አዕረፈ። እግዚአብሔር፡ እምኵሉ፡ ግብሩ።
ወሞተ፡ አዳም፡ በ፱፻ ወ፴፡ ሊተሃ፡ ዓመት፡ በመዋዕሊሁ።

msItem.incipit: ሒሴት ሐይወ፡ ፪፻ወ፭ ዓ፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለሄኖስ።
ሂአኖ መገቦሙ፡ ለሕዝቡ፡ ወኮበ፡ ኮኖ፡ ፻፱፻፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለቃይናን፡
፬። ቃይናን፡ ሐሕይወ፡ ፻ወ፸፡ ዓ፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለመላልኢል፡
መላልኤል፡፷፭፻ ሐሕይወ፡ ፻ወ፷ወ፭፡ ዓ፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለያሬድ።
ያሬድ፡ ፯ ሐሕይወ። ፻፷ወ፭። ዓመ፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለሂኖስ።

ሂኖክ ፯
መገቦሙ፡ ለሕዝቡ፡ ወባም፻፷፭ ዓ።
ማቱሳላ፰ ሐሕይወ፡ ፻፹ወ፪ ዓ፡ ወወልዶ፡ ለላሚኅ።
ባሚህ፱ ሐሕይወ፡ ፻፹ወ፪ ዓ፡ ወወልዶ። ወወልዶ፡ ለኖኅ፡
ኖኅ ሐሕይወ፡ ፬፻፴፬ ዓ፡ ወወለዶ፡ ለሲም፡
ሴም፲፬ ሐሕ እምድኅረ፡ አይኅ፡ ፪፻፡ ዓ ወወልዶ፡ ለአርፋክስድ፡

The name Eber is wanting.
The name Ehud is confused to ናአድ፡ and ናኡድ፡.
The name Jabin is confused to ኢያሚን፡.
Confused to ላባን፡.
The chapters and are wanting. A short notice on was added on the top margin above .
possibly omitted.
Wrongly attributed to ʾAmoṣ.
Entitled ወምናስዮስ፡ and merged with the following chapter, confusing Cambyses, Daryos I and Nebuchadnezzar.
Entitled ሰርብዮስ፡.
Referred to as ʾAgriṗā in the incipit and as ʾAqlodis in the explicit.

msItem.title: Treatise on the patriarchs of Alexandria

msItem.note: Indicated as Baṭlus

Indicated as ʾƎlla ʾAskǝndǝros.

List of Egyptian and Ethiopian kings
List of Egyptian kings and possibly other kings
Small stories on Diocletian and Constantine
Small stories on Diocletian
msItem.note: Change of hands on .

An annotated translation of this commentary was published in 63-156. Two successive folios have been numbered 95, and some folios have been misplaced in the binding. The correct order of the folios is: , , , , . Fols. are written in a poor hand. Then a bold clear hand takes over abruptly, and continues certainly to , and possibly to , though it becomes less regular, and from onwards, passim, short passages are in another, poorer, hand. The good hand is also that of the commentary on the Nicene creed immediately preceding (cf. ).

handNote.desc: A bold clear hand, which continues certainly to , and possibly to , though it becomes less regular.
Short passages in a poorer hand than above.

origin.origDate: Overtext from the second half of the 17th or from the 18th century.

An otherwise unknown and probably spurious homily of on the Resurrection for Easter Tuesday, in which is embedded the of .

msItem.title: Act. 9:10-11:22
msItem.note: Folios stem from the same quire and have been folded backwards. The text was consequently reversed from their prior orientation.

This fragmentary witness is among the oldest known material evidence of this work and is about a century earlier than any available to the edition of , bearing various linguistic archaisms and unique variant readings aligning with the Greek Vorlage corroborating their antiquity.
Indicated with codex κ in 411-413, 415-416.
